Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.sparse

Class SparseMatrix

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.sparse.SparseMatrix
Direct Known Subclasses:
SparseMatrixHuge, SparseMatrixStandard
public abstract class SparseMatrix extends Object
SparseMatrix and SparseMatrixHuge both inherit this interface. Either concrete class can be instantiated and used in code that manipulates a SparseMatrix object. Concrete classes store a sparse matrix in one or more of three standard sparse matrix representations including triplet (row, column, value arrays), Compressed Sparse Column or CSC (compressed sorted column, row, value arrays), or Compressed Sparse Row or CSR (compressed sorted row, column, value arrays). Any one of, or all three representations may exist simultaneously. When inserting new elements the triplet form is automatically created if it does not exist. Elements are only inserted into triplet form and only retrieved in CSC or CSR form. Sparse Vector (SV) objects can wrap the CSR or CSC forms to provide convenient sparse matrix row or column access without incurring any significant additional storage penalty. This is because the SV object is a lightweight container that uses the SparseMatrix object as the actual container (no copying) and references the contents based on SV size and start locations within the SparseMatrix. Methods are provided to create arrays of SV objects for either CSR or CSC representations.
Author:
jrhipp

    • add

      public abstract void add(int row, int col, double value) throws IOException
      Adds a new entry to the sparse matrix at the input row and column. If the triplet form does not exist it is recreated before the element is added. Also, the CSR and CSC forms are destroyed, as they are no longer valid. The triplet form is set to unsorted after the insertion.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the new entry.
      col - The column index of the new entry.
      value - The new entries value.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getCSRVectorLength

      public abstract int getCSRVectorLength(int row) throws IOException
      Returns the length of the vector assigned to input CSR 'row'.
      Parameters:
      row - The row for which the vector length will be returned.
      Returns:
      The length of the vector assigned to input CSR 'row'.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getCSRValue

      public abstract double getCSRValue(int row, int index) throws IOException
      Return the value stored at the input 'row' index and the column offset 'index' from a CSR representation.
      Parameters:
      row - The matrix row index,
      index - The Sparse Vector (SV) column index from a CSR sorted representation.
      Returns:
      The value stored at the input 'row' index and the column offset 'index'.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • setCSRValue

      public abstract double setCSRValue(int row, int index, double val) throws IOException
      Sets the input 'val' into the location at the input 'row' index and the column offset 'index' for a CSR representation.
      Parameters:
      row - The matrix row index,
      index - The Sparse Vector (SV) column index from a CSR sorted representation.
      val - The new value to be set.
      Returns:
      The previous value stored at the input 'row' index and the column offset 'index'.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getCSRColumn

      public abstract double getCSRColumn(int row, int index) throws IOException
      Return the column stored at the input 'row' index and the column offset 'index' from a CSR representation.
      Parameters:
      row - The matrix row index,
      index - The Sparse Vector (SV) column index from a CSR sorted representation.
      Returns:
      The column index stored at the input 'row' index and the the column offset 'index'.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • setCSRColumn

      public abstract int setCSRColumn(int row, int index, int column) throws IOException
      Sets the column index stored at the input 'row' index and the column offset 'index' for a CSR representation. Note: This destroys the sort order of the Sparse Vector (SV) for the input 'row'. Call sortCSRRow(int row) after finishing to restore the SV for the input 'row' to sorted order.
      Parameters:
      row - The matrix row index,
      index - The Sparse Vector (SV) column index from a CSR sorted representation.
      column - The column index to be set.
      Returns:
      The previous column index stored at the input 'row' index and the column offset 'index'.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • sortCSRRow

      public abstract void sortCSRRow(int row) throws IOException
      Sorts the sparse vector associated with the input row. If CSR does not exist it is created (which automatically sorts at creation).
      Parameters:
      row - The CSR row to be sorted.
      Throws:
      IOException
